result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on April 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Br. 9

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle, via phone.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF1052, Court grants the State's motion. Bail to be held in trust.  Calendar call scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Boyle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed on 14CF1052. Defense states they are waiting for a global resolution.  Defense needs to contact ADA Boese for an offer.  Defense requests a jury status/jury trial date on 14CF1052. Case 14CF227 to trail along on the status date with 14CF1052. Court grants request. Court will also set case 14CF227 for a jury status/jury trial at the end of March if not resolved on 02/26/2015.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on January 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises the defendant has another case - 14CF1052 and both cases are to be brought in on the next date. Attorney Rosario is appointed on case 14CF1052. Court grants request and Atty. Boyle and Atty. Rosario are both given the next date.  Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per the Defendant Attorney Boyle is ill and will not be appearing and requests a further proceeding date.  Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on December 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Br. 9

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle via phone.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they are looking for a global offer and requests another date in 30 days. State has no objection. Bail stands as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Boyle states his client has another charge and requests another date. Court will give another date on this case. Send in 14CF1052 on the next date with this matter.  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Boyle states he and his client request to enter a plea, but needs another date. Court will give a plea/sentencing date so Attorney Boyle can contact ADA Osborne.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Jury status hearing on September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
To adjourn, filed by Atty Boyle.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Peter Wolff on behalf of Atty. Rachel Bichanich.  Timothy A. Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wolff requests another date. Court will set this matter on the status/trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any Walgreens pharmacy.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney Rachel A. Bichanich.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to retain Atty. Bichanich as counsel and not Atty. Joseph Dorlack.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  State moves to modify bail.  
  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with co defendant listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walgreens pharmacy.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court, in custody, with attorney Joan Broughton.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
